name: Uppsala
fun_fact: Fun fact: Uppsala University is Scandinavia's oldest university (founded 1477) and is where Carl Linnaeus - the 'father of modern taxonomy' - lived and worked for 35 years. The Linnaeus Garden, Sweden's oldest botanical garden (1655), was where potatoes were grown for the very first time in Sweden!

food_culture_notes: Uppsala's food scene emphasizes organic, locally-sourced produce served in season
The city combines classic Swedish food with international cuisine and innovative crossover concepts
Many restaurants focus on Swedish produce sourced from small-scale farms
Fika culture is world-renowned - taking a break for coffee and pastries is a daily ritual
As a major university city, Uppsala has a vibrant student food culture with diverse, affordable options
